intro: Doellingeria umbellata var. umbellata, commonly known as the common umbellate bluemink, is a herbaceous perennial native to the eastern United States. It features basal rosettes of narrow, bluish-gray leaves that are densely covered with fine hairs. The plant produces a tall, leafless stem bearing a cluster of small, white, umbellate flowers. It thrives in moist, rich soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it a notable species in wetland ecosystems.
